org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin

Class AbstractThreadedObservablePlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin.AbstractPlugin
      • org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin.AbstractObservablePlugin
        • org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin.AbstractThreadedObservablePlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObservablePluginNotifier, ObservablePlugin, Plugin

    public abstract class AbstractThreadedObservablePlugin
extends AbstractObservablePlugin
    Provides the means to observe a plugin (insertion/removal of readers) using a monitoring thread.
    Since:
    0.9

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin

    • Method Detail

      • fetchNativeReadersNames

        protected abstract java.util.SortedSet<java.lang.String> fetchNativeReadersNames()
        Fetch the list of connected native reader (usually from third party library) and returns their names (or id)
        Returns:
        connected readers' name list
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the card has failed
        Since:
        0.9

      • fetchNativeReader

        protected abstract Reader fetchNativeReader(java.lang.String name)
        Fetch connected native reader (from third party library) by its name Returns the current AbstractReader if it is already listed. Creates and returns a new AbstractReader if not.
        Parameters:
        name - the reader name
        Returns:
        the list of AbstractReader objects.
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderNotFoundException - if the reader was not found by its name
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the card has failed
        Since:
        0.9

      • addObserver

        public final void addObserver(ObservablePlugin.PluginObserver observer)
        Add a plugin observer.

        Overrides the method defined in AbstractObservablePlugin, a thread is created if it does not already exist (when the first observer is added).

        Register the PluginObservationExceptionHandler returned by the plugin implementation of getObservationExceptionHandler as an uncaught exception handler.

        Specified by:
        addObserver in interface ObservablePlugin
        Overrides:
        addObserver in class AbstractObservablePlugin
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If observer is null or no PluginObservationExceptionHandler has been set.
        Since:
        0.9

      • removeObserver

        public final void removeObserver(ObservablePlugin.PluginObserver observer)
        Remove a plugin observer.

        Overrides the method defined in AbstractObservablePlugin, the monitoring thread is ended when the last observer is removed.

        Specified by:
        removeObserver in interface ObservablePlugin
        Overrides:
        removeObserver in class AbstractObservablePlugin
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer object
        Since:
        0.9

      • clearObservers

        public final void clearObservers()
        Remove all observers at once

        In addition to the super method in AbstractObservablePlugin, the thread is ended.

        Specified by:
        clearObservers in interface ObservablePlugin
        Overrides:
        clearObservers in class AbstractObservablePlugin
        Since:
        0.9

      • getObservationExceptionHandler

        protected abstract PluginObservationExceptionHandler getObservationExceptionHandler()
        Allows to call the defined handler when an exception condition needs to be transmitted to the application level.

        Must be implemented by the plugin provider.

        Returns:
        A not null reference to an object implementing the PluginObservationExceptionHandler interface.
        Since:
        1.0
